post: Service comes in many forms. In our latest Honoring Service episode, Jeremy Dobos, a former Army intelligence officer and President & CEO of Master Printing + Mailing, sits down with BRI's Gerald Gangaram, to reflect on the significance of taking the oath to defend the U. S. Constitution, which he describes as the framework for everything we have thats good in this country. " Dobos encourages young people to get involved in their communities through volunteering and charitable work. Watch the interview here.  https://lnkd.in/e3zXu8NW At The Bill of Rights Institute, we believe in fostering active citizenship. How are you serving your community today?  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #CivicEngagement

Federal Flags, LLC makes all-American-made flags and flag poles. Any purchase made on their site using the code 'BRI' at checkout supports the civic mission of the Bill of Rights Institute. They sell American flags, state flags, military flags, and much more. Find the perfect flag or flagpole for your space and support BRI today!  https://lnkd.in/eiWhveG2

America needs a Sputnik moment for civics. In his new op-ed in The Fulcrum, BRI President and CEO David Bobb discusses the vital soft skills young people develop in civics classes – and why employers are valuing those skills more than ever. As one North Carolina teacher told us, civics is a course in critical thinking and analysis, understanding various perspectives, and expanding beyond ones own thoughts.  See why its time to start viewing civics through a career-readiness framework.  https://bit.ly/4khHOPv

Meet BRIs 2025 Student Fellow, Iago Macknik-Conde! He is a 12th-grade student in Brooklyn, NY. Iago is the national winner of the Captain Ken Coskey Naval History Prize and a two-time NY State Gold Medalist at National History Day. Iago also received First Prize in the National Essay Contest hosted by the National World War II Museum in 2019, the Ned Vizzini Teen Writing Prize for Poetry in 2020, the Carl Sandburg Student Poetry Prize in 2023, and the George Watt Essay Prize in 2023. He is a Hispanic Heritage Foundation Youth Awardee and a recipient of The Congressional Awards Gold Medal and the Presidents Volunteer Service Award. Learn more about our Student Fellowship program today!  https://bit.ly/3f2q66h

Inspire the next generation of citizens and join the Civic Star Challenge! 🎉 Celebrate 250 years of American independence by bringing the ideals of the Declaration of Independence to life in your classroom with the Civic Star Challenge, a nationwide call to K–12 educators to spark meaningful conversations, hands-on learning, and civic action. How to participate: 📘 Engage: Use ready-to-go, flexible lesson plans to teach the Declarations timeless themes. 📸 Share: Submit a simple form to spotlight your students activities. 🏆 Win: Earn the chance to win exciting prizes throughout the school year! Tap the link in bio to sign up now and be the first to hear when the Civic Star Challenge launches in August 2025!  https://lnkd.in/eQsPQWCj 🤝 @icivicsinc  #CivicLearning  #CivicEducation  #Civics  #iCivics

BRI's President, David Bobb, recently appeared on the Dallas-Fort Worth PBS program Perspectives Matter with John Meko, President of Founding Forward. They discussed the current state of civic education in America. Watch this interview to learn how BRI emphasizes the importance of combining foundational civic knowledge with practical citizenship skills that students can develop and apply.  https://bit.ly/43gqGC8

Meet BRIs 2025 Student Fellow, Albert Cai! Albert is a junior at Barrington High School. He's interested in all things politics and government, especially foreign affairs. In his free time, Albert enjoys spending time with friends, going to the gym, and researching for his school debate team, of which he is a captain. Learn more about our Student Fellowship program today!

Empower educators with Pocket Constitutions! These compact guides are essential for illuminating our Constitutional Republic's foundations to future voters and leaders. Check out BRI's newest way to support local civics education! Your donation equips teachers in a state you choose with this vital resource, fostering a deeper understanding of our nation's laws among today's students. Join us in cultivating informed, engaged citizens for tomorrow. Support a Civics Champion today, supply a teacher with Pocket Constitutions!  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #CivicEducation  https://bit.ly/4mp0Epg
